html:
Instructions for the Final Rask

As mentioned previously, Speedy Stream aims to offer an online video streaming service for cars via satellite internet, which works even in locations without mobile network. The satellite internet is currently expensive and has limited bandwidth. The company's goal is to offer an affordable product while meeting the needs of our customers. We want you, the survey participants, to complete a task.

This is the last section of the survey. The system has randomly distributed all participants into two groups: the designer group and the buyer group. You are assigned to the designer group. Let us explain how these two groups work together.

A video player is composed of functions that take care of the five video elements you experienced earlier. There is a cost for each element to work, and the buyer has to pay for it. Think of it as assembling a video player. As a designer, your job is to choose between one of the two qualities for each of these components that go into the final product of this video player. Following the selection, you will set a price that you thinks resembles that component. The sum of the five component prices becomes the total price that video streaming service costs.

Our system uses your demographic information and the preference survey that you filled out earlier to locate a participant from the buyer's group. This buyer is very similar to you . Buyer have the incentive to get the most bang for thir buck, as they would consider the quality-price ratio. They will decide if they will buy the product you designed. If the buyer accepts the product you created, you will receive a commission. The commission is 10% of the total price.
